intro: Senecio torrehuasensis, commonly known as the Huasco senecio, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous stems. This species is adapted to harsh, dry environments, featuring small, narrow leaves to minimize water loss. The plant produces yellowish to brownish flowers, which are typically arranged in dense, spherical clusters. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils along coastal areas, showcasing its resilience to extreme conditions.
